tasks.task: Understanding and designing a furrow irrigation system.
subtasks: Establishing the relationship between advance time infiltration and deposition collation.
Applying the Caustico relationship to determine infiltration depth and time.
Considering soil uniformity and initial moisture content assumptions.
Dividing the total irrigation time into intervals (δT) to model infiltration.
Calculating depth of infiltration (δZ) in each interval using the Caustico equation.
Analyzing the trend of infiltration depth along the field length.
Determining average and maximum deep percolation (predicted as 5.6% in this case).
Understanding the fractional advance ratio (FAR) and its impact on deep percolation losses.
Considering the design parameters for furrow irrigation systems, including slope, soil type, and discharge rates.
Evaluating the potential for erosion and farmers' practices in irrigation design.

tasks.task: Design considerations for furrow irrigation systems.
subtasks: Assessing the risk of surface runoff and erosion based on field slope and soil type.
Evaluating the appropriate stream size for a given field and soil conditions.
Considering rainfall intensity and timing in relation to irrigation schedules.
Incorporating local farming experiences into design practices for optimal efficiency and soil conservation.
